title: Blue Bottle Coffee French Press
preparation_steps: Grind 30 grams of coffee to medium-coarse consistency
Pre-warm French Press with hot water
Add 30g ground coffee to French Press

brewing_steps.instruction: Start timer and pour 480g hot water in slow spiral
brewing_steps.audio_script: Start your timer. Pour 480 grams of hot water in a slow, deliberate spiral. You have 25 seconds. This ensures all grounds are saturated evenly from the start.

brewing_steps.instruction: Stir gently 4 times to ensure even saturation
brewing_steps.audio_script: Stir gently four times. You have 30 seconds. This agitation helps to wet any floating grounds and starts the extraction process evenly.

brewing_steps.instruction: Place lid on top, do not press plunger
brewing_steps.audio_script: Place the lid on the French Press to keep it warm, but do not press yet. Let it sit.
Now wait for 4 and a half minutes. This time allows the coffee to bloom and extract fully, developing its body and sweetness.

brewing_steps.instruction: Press plunger down slowly, pour within 15 seconds
brewing_steps.audio_script: Press the plunger down slowly and consistently. Aim to finish and pour within 15 seconds to capture the peak flavor.

what_to_expect.description: Blue Bottle's French Press method focuses on precision and consistency. The slow spiral pour and gentle stirring ensure even extraction, while the medium-coarse grind provides the perfect balance of body and clarity.
what_to_expect.audio_script: Blue Bottle's approach is all about consistency. With a slow spiral pour and gentle stirring, we ensure every ground is extracted evenly for a balanced cup.

notes: Blue Bottle's French Press method focuses on precision and consistency. The slow spiral pour and gentle stirring ensure even extraction, while the medium-coarse grind provides the perfect balance of body and clarity.
